FacilityName: Nestle Prepared Foods Company - Jonesboro, AR

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary



Nestle has made a commitment to provide all employees with a safe work environment and take whatever steps necessary to prevent injuries and illnesses resulting from unsafe acts or conditions during the hours of operation. Our goal as a company is to comply with federal, state and local laws. The entire management team has the responsibility of providing our employees with an environment conducive to an atmosphere of safety.



Ammonia safety is a priority within our facility. Our goal is to prevent problems, through the use of our preventive maintenance program that we enforce. The purpose is to identify and prevent potentially unsafe conditions and make necessary modifications before problems develop. Our ongoing program is designed to maintain the integrity of the system and assure that all employees are properly trained and meet the requirements to operate our equipment within the boundaries of our PSM/RMP program.



The Facility Maintenance Team Leader is responsible for the management of the ammonia safety program.





Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled



Nestle Jonesboro Plant produces and packages frozen prepared foods. The facility uses ammonia in its refrigeration system as a heat transfer medium.  Ammonia is the only regulated substance handled at the Jonesboro Plant.





Description of the Accidental Release Prevention Program



The facility has a level 3 accident release prevention program for the ammonia system that complies with OSHA's Process Safety Management Standard and EPA's Risk Management Program Regulations. The ammonia prevention program consists of the following elements:



? Employee Participation

? Process Safety Information

? Process Hazard Analysis

? Operating Procedures

? Training Programs

? Contractor Program

? Mechanical Integrity Program

? Hot Work Permit Procedure

? Management of Change Procedures

? Incident Investigation

? Compliance Audit Procedure

? Pre-Startup Safety Procedur

e

 

 

 Five Year Accident History 

 

No ammonia-related incidents occurred at the Jonesboro Facility during the previous five years that resulted in significant off-site consequences.

 

 

 Description of the Emergency Response Program

 

 An emergency response program has been implemented at the Jonesboro Plant. This program contains procedures describing how the facility will respond to fires, ammonia leaks and other emergencies.

 

 The emergency response program includes the following elements:

 

? Ammonia Leak Procedures 

? Emergency Evacuation Plan

? Emergency Response Team Responsibilities





Planned Changes to Improve Safety 



Nestle is committed to operating our ammonia refrigeration system in a safe and responsible manner.  We are continually evaluating our equipment and procedures to meet this objective.  Since all measures identified have already been implemented to date, however, there are no current planned changes to further improve safety at the facility.
